alert.note: Alert for Bee; Goliad; Live Oak; Victoria (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Hard Freeze Warning issued January 15 at 2:48AM CST until January 15 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...HARD FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...HARD FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST TUESDAY... ...HARD FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the first Hard Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 24. For the Freeze Warning, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 26 expected. For the second Hard Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 21 expected. For the Hard Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 17 possible. * WHERE...Live Oak, Bee, Goliad and Victoria Counties. * WHEN...For the first Hard Freeze Warning, until noon CST today. For the Freeze Warning, from noon today to midnight CST tonight. For the second Hard Freeze Warning, from midnight tonight to noon CST Tuesday. For the Hard Freeze Watch, from Tuesday evening through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
